title: The Type Error
text: What is the definition of a Type I Error?

hintAnswer: The decision is to reject $$H_0$$ when $$H_0$$ is true.
title: Type I error
text: Choose the best answer from the following.
choices: The decision is to reject $$H_0$$ when $$H_0$$ is true.
The decision is not to reject $$H_0$$ when, in fact, $$H_0$$ is false.

title: Type I error under problem setting
text: Type I error: The emergency crew thinks that the victim is dead when, in fact, the victim is alive.

title: The Type Error
text: What is the definition of a Type II Error?

hintAnswer: The decision is not to reject $$H_0$$ when, in fact, $$H_0$$ is false.
title: Type II error
text: Choose the best answer from the following.
choices: The decision is to reject $$H_0$$ when $$H_0$$ is true.
The decision is not to reject $$H_0$$ when, in fact, $$H_0$$ is false.

title: Type II error under problem setting
text: Type II error: The emergency crew does not know if the victim is alive when, in fact, the victim is dead.

title: Type I vs. Type II error
text: The error with the greater consequence is the Type I error. (If the emergency crew thinks the victim is dead, they will not treat him.)
